alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 01 at 1:27AM PDT until October 01 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING ABOVE 8000 FEET... * CHANGES...Updated snow totals through Sunday. * WHAT...Snow, mainly above 8000 feet. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches between 8000 and 10000 feet, with totals 2 to 6 inches above 10000 feet. 4 to 8 inches possible across the White Mountains. * WHERE...Mono County including areas around Sonora Pass, Tioga Pass, Mammoth Mountain, and the White Mountains. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT Sunday. Snowfall will be intermittent, with the heaviest snow rates occurring Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions over mountain passes. Isolated thunderstorms with cloud to ground lightning strikes are possible this afternoon.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall can cause significant travel delays. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. Check with Caltrans for the latest road conditions.
